lead_paragraph: The PGA Tour changed the final month of its FedEx Cup competition that starts next year, reducing the field in two tournaments before the final 30 players are left to chase the $10 million prize at the Tour Championship.The original plan was for 144-man fields at the Barclays Classic in Harrison, N.Y., the Deutsche Bank Championship outside Boston and the BMW Championship near Chicago. Those players qualified through a yearlong points system. Under the revision announced yesterday, only the opening playoff event, at the Barclays Classic, will have 144 players.
